comments.author: holydarkness
comments.body: Quote from: JudgeTorres on November 03, 2023, 07:20:14 PMAny comments on thisAight, since you nicely asked... let's talk about some discrepancies. First, you said this below, that your tokenomy consist of 18% sent to burn address and 82% for liquidity, with no team token, it was also written on your whitepaperQuote from: JudgeTorres on October 23, 2023, 02:24:46 PM[...]TOKENOMICS18% Burned, 82% Pancakeswap Liquidity Locked - NO TEAM TOKENS![...]but on that very same whitepaper, it's said,The percentage of XRP reward also incoherent, one part said 10%, the other part 8%

comments.author: JudgeTorres
comments.body: Hello, you are right, we overlooked the editing in this section, we will correct it, thank you for making the observation, have a great day.

comments.author: holydarkness
comments.body: Quote from: JudgeTorres on November 06, 2023, 01:38:21 PMHello, you are right, we overlooked the editing in this section, we will correct it, thank you for making the observation, have a great day.You're joking? That's all you can explain? Don't you even bother to proof-read the paper, that literally serves as your business proposal, before publishing it? Shouldn't you do it if you really care and put a lot of effort on your project? Well, at least that's you being honest.If we talk about team... how many people in your team, again?

comments.author: JudgeTorres
comments.body: Hi, nice to meet you, I am not the owner of the project, I am part of the Judge Torres team, we are a group of 13 people on the project. Thanks for your interest

comments.author: holydarkness
comments.body: Quote from: JudgeTorres on November 07, 2023, 02:37:23 PMHi, nice to meet you, I am not the owner of the project, I am part of the Judge Torres team, we are a group of 13 people on the project. Thanks for your interestThirteen people and none realized or have any time to proof-read the document before publishing it? A document that's very crucial on presenting your business? Nice. I think it shows enough of the seriousness of this project. I'm out.

comments.author: JudgeTorres
comments.body: I see that you are only here to criticize and point out, how badly that says about you as a person.

comments.author: holydarkness
comments.body: Quote from: JudgeTorres on November 08, 2023, 01:59:24 PMI see that you are only here to criticize and point out, how badly that says about you as a person.That's highly dependant on which side and perspective we see it. From an investor who currently in the middle of their DD? I think they'll find it useful and someone nicely pointed things out. From the perspective of a project with questionable quality? Yeah, I can understand why you don't like it when someone pointed out crucial flaws of your project, and spelled it out how it translated to incompetence, and how likely the project gone missing in a very near future.You don't want to be criticized and your mistakes pointed out? I suggest next time when you have another shady project, make sure you re-read your whitepaper before publishing it.

comments.author: JudgeTorres
comments.body: Hello again, nice to greet you:1.- Place the project is not shady and will not disappear in the future2.- Place, it doesn't bother me that they give points of view and suggestions to the project, as long as they are constructive and not destructive criticisms like you are mentioning.3.- It was just a transcription error in a paragraph, it does not give you the right to reproach or say that it is a shady project.

comments.author: ComBanks
comments.body: Absolutely agree with holydarkness. When numbers "float" in official documents, investor confidence decreases.
